螉字的基本解释

螉
wēng
〔螉??〕寄生在牛马皮上的小蜂。
〔蠮螉〕见“
蠮”。

螉字的汉语字典释义

[①]［wēng］
［《廣韻》烏紅切，平東，影。］
(1)虫名。即牛虻。
(2)见“蠮螉”。

螉字的康熙字典解释

【申集中】【虫字部】　螉； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页1092第32
【唐韻】【正韻】烏紅切【集韻】烏公切，?音翁。【玉篇】蠮螉，蟲名，細腰蜂也。【揚子·方言】蠭，燕、趙之閒謂之蠓螉，其小者謂之蠮螉。　又蠮螉塞，地名。【晉書·慕容皝載記】皝率騎二萬，出蠮螉塞，長驅至于薊城。　又螉䗥，牛馬皮中蟲也。【梁?·文帝詩】控弦因鵲血，挽繮用牛螉。　又【類篇】烏孔切，音蓊。義同。

螉字的源字形

字源演变：

小篆楷体

字形对比：

中国大陆宋体台湾细明体香港明体日本明朝体韩国明朝体旧字形
螉字的起名意思

暂无。

Scorpion
Basic explanation of words
Scorpion
wēng
〔螉??〕 A small wasp parasitic on the skin of cows and horses.
[蠮螉] See "
蠮".
Scorpion
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［wēng］
["Guangyun" Wu Hongqi, Pingdong, shadow. ]
(1) Insect name. Namely Gadfly.
(2) See "蠮艉".
Scorpion
Kangxi dictionary interpretation of words
[Shenzhen Collection] [Insect Character Department] 　螉; Kangxi Strokes: 16; Page Number: Page 1092 Page 32
[Tang Yun] [Zheng Yun] Wu Hong cut [Ji Yun] Wu Gong cut,? Yin Weng. [Jade articles] worms, insect names, and slender bees. 【Yangtze Dialect】Zhi, Yan and Zhao Zhixian are called midges, and the smaller ones are called midges.　 and 蠮螉塞, place name. [Book of Jin·Murong Jai's Records] Jai rate rides 20,000 yuan, goes out of the wormhole, and drove to Jicheng for a long time.　It's a bitch again, and there are worms in the skin of cows and horses. [Liang?·Wendi Poems] The control string is controlled by magpie's blood, and the rein is used to pull the rein.　[Classes] Wukongqie, sound. The same meaning.
